gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10-11 - Th234 Particulate from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Particulate Thorium-234 from in situ pumps. Dataset Description: <p>Particulate Th-234 from in situ pumps, including large size fraction (&gt; 51 um) and small size fraction (1-51 um), from the 2010 and 2011 U.S. GEOTRACES cruises.<br />&nbsp;</p><p>Please note that some US GEOTRACES data may not be final, pending intercalibration results and further analysis. If you are interested in following changes to US GEOTRACES NAT data, there is an RSS feed available via the BCO-DMO <a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/project/2066">US GEOTRACES project page</a> (scroll down and expand the "Datasets" section).</p> Acquisition Description: <p>Particulate material was collected using in situ McLane pumps (also see data from Charette and Lam groups). All data were decay corrected back to the mid-pump times.</p><p><strong>1-51 um Th-234</strong><br />On KN199-4, the mesh screens were cut in half and the material from one half was rinsed onto a silver filter and dried down. On KN 204-01a and KN 204-01b, the whole mesh screen was rinsed onto a silver filter and dried down. The mean volume pumped through the whole Supor mesh screens was 475 L.</p><p><strong>&gt;51 um Th-234</strong><br />Whole QMAs, located below a mesh screen in the filter head housing, were oven-dried upon recovery. A 25 mm subsample was taken from this whole filter for beta counting for Th-234. The mean effective volume for the 25 mm QMA subsample was 47 L.</p><p><strong>See:</strong><br />Maiti, K., K.O. Buesseler, S.M. Pike, C. Benitez-Nelson, P. Cai, W. Chen, K. Cochran, M. Dai, F. Dehairs, B. Gasser, R.P. Kelly, P. Masque, L.A. Miller, J.C. Miquel, S.B. Moran, P.J. Morris, F. Peine, F. Planchon, A.A. Renfro, M. Rutgers van der Loeff, P.H. Santschi, R. Turnewitsch, J.T. Waples, and C. Xu (2012). Intercalibration studies of short-lived thorium-234 in the water column and marine particles. L&amp;O Methods, 10: 631-644. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.631" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.631</a><br /><br />Buesseler, K.O., S. Pike, K. Maiti, C.H. Lamborg, D.A. Siegel and T.W. Trull (2009). Thorium-234 as a tracer of spatial, temporal and vertical variability in particle flux in the North Pacific. Deep-Sea Research I, 56 (1143-1167). doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr.2009.04.001" target="_blank">10.1016/j.dsr.2009.04.001</a></p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0925158 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=0925158&HistoricalAwards=false

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31568.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: text Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31569.rdf Name: cruise_part Units: text Description: Part of cruise. For KN204-01:A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda)B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia, Cabo Verde) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31570.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31571.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude. Positive = North. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31572.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude. Negative = West. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31573.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Event #', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31574.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Cast', this parametername has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31575.rdf Name: month_gmt Units: mm (01 to 12) Description: 2-digit month of year (GMT). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31576.rdf Name: day_gmt Units: dd (01 to 31) Description: 2-digit day of month (GMT). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31577.rdf Name: year Units: YYYY Description: 4-digit year. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31578.rdf Name: time_gmt Units: HHMM Description: Time (GMT); 24-hour clock. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31579.rdf Name: pump Units: unitless Description: Pump number. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31580.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Geotraces #', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31581.rdf Name: depth_n Units: meters Description: Nominal sample depth. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31582.rdf Name: depth Units: meters Description: Actual sample depth; provided in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31583.rdf Name: Th234_p_1to51 Units: dpm/Liter Description: Particulate Thorium-234 from QMA filters. Particle size of 1 to 51 um. Data were decay corrected back to mid-pump times. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31584.rdf Name: Th234_p_1to51_unc Units: dpm/Liter Description: Th234_p_1to51 uncertainty. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31585.rdf Name: Th234_p_gt51 Units: dpm/Liter Description: Particulate Thorium-234 from mesh screens, filtered onto silver filters. Particle size greater than 51 um. Data were decay corrected back to mid-pump times. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31586.rdf Name: Th234_p_gt51_unc Units: dpm/Liter Description: Th234_p_gt51 uncertainty. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31587.rdf Name: q_flag Units: unitless Description: Quality flag:1 = Good2 = Questionable3 = Bad http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33188.rdf Name: ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.ssZ Description: Cast date/time (UTC) formatted to ISO8601 standard. T indicates start of time string; Z indicates UTC. Calculated from original date and time fields. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33189.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33190.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33191.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33192.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/YEARXXXX/ Name: Year since birth of Christ Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z' http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: Part of cruise. For KN204-01:A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda)B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia, Cabo Verde); General Description: Identifier for a segment of a leg of a cruise, where a leg may have been broken into parts.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Latitude. Positive = North.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude. Negative = West.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Event #', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Cast', this parametername has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: cast or profile number
PI-supplied Description: 2-digit month of year (GMT).; General Description: month of year, GMT time , i.e. 01-12
PI-supplied Description: 2-digit day of month (GMT).; General Description: day, GMT time e.g. 22.
PI-supplied Description: 4-digit year.; General Description: year, reported as YYYY, e.g. 1995 NERC Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ.
PI-supplied Description: Time (GMT); 24-hour clock.; General Description: time of day, reported in GMT time, 24 hour clock
PI-supplied Description: Pump number.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Geotraces #', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: Nominal sample depth.; General Description: depth; nominal

PI-supplied Description: Actual sample depth; provided in original data submission.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Particulate Thorium-234 from QMA filters. Particle size of 1 to 51 um. Data were decay corrected back to mid-pump times.; General Description: thorium-234 particulate activity measurement of some type, usually of a particular size fraction
PI-supplied Description: Th234_p_1to51 uncertainty.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Particulate Thorium-234 from mesh screens, filtered onto silver filters. Particle size greater than 51 um. Data were decay corrected back to mid-pump times.; General Description: thorium-234 particulate activity measurement of some type, usually of a particular size fraction
PI-supplied Description: Th234_p_gt51 uncertainty.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag:1 = Good2 = Questionable3 = Bad; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Cast date/time (UTC) formatted to ISO8601 standard. T indicates start of time string; Z indicates UTC. Calculated from original date and time fields.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>Particulate material was collected using in situ McLane pumps (also see data from Charette and Lam groups). All data were decay corrected back to the mid-pump times.</p><p><strong>1-51 um Th-234</strong><br />On KN199-4, the mesh screens were cut in half and the material from one half was rinsed onto a silver filter and dried down. On KN 204-01a and KN 204-01b, the whole mesh screen was rinsed onto a silver filter and dried down. The mean volume pumped through the whole Supor mesh screens was 475 L.</p><p><strong>&gt;51 um Th-234</strong><br />Whole QMAs, located below a mesh screen in the filter head housing, were oven-dried upon recovery. A 25 mm subsample was taken from this whole filter for beta counting for Th-234. The mean effective volume for the 25 mm QMA subsample was 47 L.</p><p><strong>See:</strong><br />Maiti, K., K.O. Buesseler, S.M. Pike, C. Benitez-Nelson, P. Cai, W. Chen, K. Cochran, M. Dai, F. Dehairs, B. Gasser, R.P. Kelly, P. Masque, L.A. Miller, J.C. Miquel, S.B. Moran, P.J. Morris, F. Peine, F. Planchon, A.A. Renfro, M. Rutgers van der Loeff, P.H. Santschi, R. Turnewitsch, J.T. Waples, and C. Xu (2012). Intercalibration studies of short-lived thorium-234 in the water column and marine particles. L&amp;O Methods, 10: 631-644. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.631" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.631</a><br /><br />Buesseler, K.O., S. Pike, K. Maiti, C.H. Lamborg, D.A. Siegel and T.W. Trull (2009). Thorium-234 as a tracer of spatial, temporal and vertical variability in particle flux in the North Pacific. Deep-Sea Research I, 56 (1143-1167). doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr.2009.04.001" target="_blank">10.1016/j.dsr.2009.04.001</a></p>

<p>Data were flagged with quality indicators: 1 = Good; 2 = Questionable; 3 = Bad.</p><p>BCO-DMO made the following modifications:<br />- Parameter names have been modified to conform with BCO-DMO naming conventions.<br />- 'NaN' was replaced with 'nd' to indicate 'no data'.<br />- cruise_part was separated from the official cruise ID for cruise KN204-01.<br />- Added ISO_DateTime_UTC from the original date and time fields provided for each cast/event.</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.<br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: McLane Pump PI Supplied Instrument Description:Particulate material was collected using in situ McLane pumps. Instrument Name: McLane Pump Instrument Short Name:McLane Pump Instrument Description: McLane pumps sample large volumes of seawater at depth. They are attached to a wire and lowered to different depths in the ocean. As the water is pumped through the filter, particles suspended in the ocean are collected on the filters. The pumps are then retrieved and the contents of the filters are analyzed in a lab.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
